title: Market & Competitor Research
intro:
Before we design anything we need a **panoramic, data-backed view** of the market: how big it is, who already dominates, where customers still feel pain, and which macro forces may shift demand.

**Google's Gemini—Deep Research mode** will be our virtual McKinsey analyst, delivering comprehensive market intelligence that forms the foundation of your strategy.

fields.label: Company Name
fields.tooltip: This is the official name for your venture that will be used throughout all AI prompts and research. Choose something memorable and brandable as it becomes central to your identity across all phases.

fields.label: Sector / Product Domain
fields.help: The slice of the market you will attack
fields.tooltip: Define the specific market niche you're entering. This helps Gemini Deep Research focus on relevant competitors, market size, and industry trends for your exact domain.

fields.label: Target Region
fields.tooltip: Your initial market focus affects regulatory considerations, competitive landscape, and market sizing data that Gemini will research. Start focused rather than global.

fields.label: Primary Brand Color
fields.help: Primary hex color for your brand
fields.tooltip: Your main brand color that will appear in all marketing materials and website designs generated in later phases. Choose a color that reflects your brand personality and stands out in your market sector.

fields.label: Secondary Brand Color
fields.help: Secondary hex color for your brand
fields.tooltip: A complementary color that works with your primary color for visual hierarchy and design variety. This will be used for accents, buttons, and secondary elements in your brand materials.

promptTemplate:
ROLE

You are a senior market-intelligence analyst and product strategist at a global consulting firm.

CONTEXT

We are evaluating the {{sector}} market in {{target_region}} for a new entrant called {{company_name}}. Our primary goal is to analyze the landscape to identify the most promising core benefit for this new venture to build around.

TASK

Produce a structured report designed to guide a strategic decision on the company's core benefit. The report must contain the following five sections:

1. Market Sizing & Growth

Current‐year (e.g., Projected 2025) TAM and SAM in USD.
Recent or Projected Market CAGR (specify timeframe, e.g., 2023-2028).
Minimum one, preferably two, independent sources per figure (link or full citation). Prioritize reputable sources.
Briefly outline key factors or common methodologies used to estimate potential SOM in this sector.
2. Competitive Landscape: Strengths & Weaknesses

Identify the Top 5 competitors based on perceived market influence in the {{sector}}.
For each competitor, create a table with the following columns:
Brand
Core Offer
Key Strengths (1-2 bullets)
Perceived Weakness / Market Gap (1-2 bullets - e.g., high price, poor user experience, missing feature, underserved niche).
Mention any significant funding or M&A events in the last 18-24 months.
3. Unmet Needs & Strategic Opportunities

Based on your research, identify a minimum of three distinct Unmet Needs.
For each Unmet Need, present it as a strategic opportunity in a table with the following columns:
Identified Unmet Need: State the customer problem clearly and concisely.
Supporting Evidence: Cite the specific data point, quote, or finding from your research that validates this need.
Strategic Context: In 1-2 sentences, explain why this is a strong opportunity (e.g., "This need is amplified by the macro trend of [Trend Name] and is a known weakness of Competitor X.").
Suggested Core Benefit: Propose a concise benefit that directly solves the Unmet Need (e.g., "Effortless Meal Planning," "Guilt-Free Creative Screen Time," "Verifiable Skills for a Modern Workforce").
4. Macro & Regulatory Trends

Identify three trends (e.g., Technological, Regulatory, Economic, Social) most likely to significantly reshape this category within the next 3 years.
Pair each with a referenced statistic or forecast.
For each trend, briefly state its potential impact (opportunity or threat) on {{company_name}}.
5. Synthesized Recommendation

Conclude the report with a brief summary (1-2 paragraphs).
Based on the entire analysis, recommend which Suggested Core Benefit from Section 3 offers the most promising strategic path for {{company_name}}.
Justify your recommendation by synthesizing insights from the competitive weaknesses, the scale of the unmet need, and alignment with macro trends.
FORMAT

Return the content in GitHub-flavored Markdown with clear H2 headers for the numbered sections. Structure tables and lists cleanly for executive presentation. Finish with a consolidated APA reference list for all cited sources.

decisionBoxContent.title: Market Research Foundation
decisionBoxContent.subtitle: Mapping the Battlefield - Understanding your market landscape before designing anything

items.label: Company Name
items.content: Choose a short, memorable brand name that will represent your startup throughout the entire bootcamp process.

items.label: Sector Definition
items.content: Define the specific slice of the market you will attack - be precise about your product domain and target demographics.

items.label: Target Region
items.content: Select your primary geography for launch - this will focus your market research and competitive analysis on the most relevant data.

items.label: Brand Colors
items.content: Choose primary and secondary brand colors early - these will be used consistently across all materials and phases.

action.title: Research Preparation
items: Define your company name and sector
Select target region and brand colors
Prepare to conduct parallel research while AI runs analysis
Set up for 12 minutes of intensive market intelligence gathering

stepByStepFlow.action: **Setup Gemini Deep Research** - Access Google's AI market analyst

steps.action: **Open Gemini** (https://gemini.google.com) in a fresh browser tab
In the chat box, **select the "Deep Research" option** - this activates Gemini's advanced research mode
Ensure you're ready to provide your company details for the market analysis

stepByStepFlow.action: **Customize & Submit Research Prompt** - Configure your market intelligence request

steps.action: **Review what you need to customize** - You'll need to fill in your company name, sector, and target region in the prompt. Have these details ready from the form fields you completed above.

**Copy the Phase 1 Prompt** from the Prompt Preview section below and paste it into Gemini
TIP: This is your market research, make sure you're getting what you want from it.
**Fill in the missing elements** with your company name, sector, and target region in the prompt you just pasted
**Make any adjustments** to the prompt that you want - this is your market research, ensure you're getting what you need
**Submit the prompt** to Gemini

stepByStepFlow.action: **Initiate AI Research** - Start Gemini's market analysis engine

steps.action: Gemini will take **a few seconds to develop a plan** of attack for your request and show it to you
You have the ability to **edit this plan**, but for now **press "Start Research"**
Gemini will now begin **searching, analyzing, and synthesizing** information across multiple sources
This process will take **4-9 minutes** - use this time productively for parallel research

stepByStepFlow.action: **Conduct Parallel Team Research** - Manual market exploration while AI works

steps.action: **Divide research tasks** among team members while Gemini works
**Explore key questions:** Where do you suspect opportunity lies? Which competitor scares you most? What are the biggest rivals?
**Use traditional research tools** (Google, Crunchbase, company websites, news) but **not AI tools**

**Fill in all form fields** based on your findings - work faster than you'd like, do your best
TIP: You will have to be faster than you would like. Do the best you can.
**Document initial hypotheses** about market gaps and competitive threats

stepByStepFlow.action: **Review & Analyze Results** - Compare AI insights with team findings

steps.action: When Gemini finishes, **click "Create"** and then **select "Infographic"**
**Review the full report** - this will be extensive, focus on key sections first

**Spend at least 5 minutes as a team** going through the report systematically
TIP: This will be far too much information for you to go over in detail at this time, but get a good overview of the Market situation.
**Carefully examine the infographic** once created - this provides visual market overview
**Compare and analyze** what your team discovered versus Gemini's findings
**Get a comprehensive overview** of the market situation before proceeding

stepByStepFlow.action: **Export Market Intelligence** - Save research for future phases

steps.action: **Click "Export"** in the Gemini interface
**Select "Export to Docs"** to save to Google Drive
**Rename the file** to "Market_Competitors" for easy identification
**Download as PDF** - this becomes your base truth document for all future phases

expectedOutput.whyItMatters: Many future projects will pull data directly from this report. This will be our base truth.
expectedOutput.nextSteps: When you've come up with your own answers, spent a little time with the report & infographic, and your PDF is saved you are ready to proceed to Phase 2 – Competitor Matrix Construction.
